paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the Gly67Ala mutation in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual case details.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with symptoms including dysphagia, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and orthostatic hypotension.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Hereditary transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis secondary to Gly67Ala mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Gly67Ala mutation is associated with transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to misfolded proteins and amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The patient has a strong family history of amyloidosis, with four out of seven siblings affected.
variants.population_frequency: Very rare, previously documented in German, Italian, and Mediterranean populations.
variants.additional_notes: Limited data on the Gly67Ala mutation in Asian populations.
key_quotes: Interestingly, our patient was discovered to have a very rare Gly67Ala TTR mutation typically not found in individuals of Asian descent.
Of note, the patient does have a strong family history of amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant Gly67Ala was extracted successfully.
